desc: When someone is afraid, they feel fear.
exam: The woman was afraid of what she saw.

desc: To agree is to say “yes” or to think the same way.
exam: A: The food is very good in that restaurant. B: I agree with you.

desc: When someone is angry, they may want to speak loudly or fight.
exam: She didn’t do her homework, so her father is angry.

desc: To arrive is to get to or reach some place.
exam: The bus always arrives at the corner of my street at 4:00.

desc: To attack is to try to fight or to hurt.
exam: The man with the sword attacked the other man first.

desc: The bottom is the lowest part.
exam: The bottom of my shoe has a hole in it.

desc: When someone is clever, they can solve a hard puzzle or problem.
exam: The clever boy thought of a good idea.

desc: When someone is cruel, they do bad things to hurt others.
exam: The cruel man yelled at his sister.

desc: If something happens finally, it happens after a longtime or at the end.
exam: He finally crossed the finish line after five hours of running.

desc: To hide is to try not to let others see you.
exam: The other children will hide while you count to 100.

desc: To hunt is to look for or search for an animal to kill.
exam: Long ago, people hunted with bows and arrows.

desc: A lot means a large number or amount of people, animals, things, etc.
exam: There are a lot of apples in the basket.

desc: The middle of something is the center or halfway point.
exam: The Canadian flag has a maple leaf in the middle of it.

desc: A moment is a second or a very short time.
exam: I was only a few moments late for the meeting.

desc: When someone is pleased, they are happy.
exam: She was pleased with the phone call she received.

desc: To promise is to say you will do something for sure.
exam: He promised to return my key by tomorrow.

desc: To reply is to give an answer or say back to someone.
exam: She asked him what time his meeting was. He replied, “at three.”

desc: When a person is safe, they are not in danger.
exam: Put on your seat belt in the car to be safe.

desc: A trick is something you do to fool another person.
exam: His card trick really surprised us.

desc: You use well to say that something was done in a good way.
exam: The couple can dance quite well.

desc: An adventure is a fun or exciting thing that you do.
exam: Riding in the rough water was an adventure.

desc: To approach something means to move close to it.
exam: The boy approached his school.

desc: Carefully means with great attention, especially to detail or safety.
exam: The baby carefully climbed down the stairs.

desc: A chemical is something that scientists use in chemistry.
exam: The scientist mixed the chemicals.

desc: To create means to make something new.
exam: She created an igloo from blocks of snow.

desc: Evil describes something or someone bad or cruel, not good.
exam: The evil figure scared us all.

desc: An experiment is a test that you do to see what will happen.
exam: The student did an experiment in science class.

desc: To kill someone or something is to make them die.
exam: I killed the fly with a fly swatter.

desc: A laboratory is a room where a scientist works.
exam: My mother works in a laboratory.

desc: Laugh is the sound made when someone is happy or a funny thing occurs.
exam: The sound of their laugh filled the room.

desc: If a sound is loud, it is strong and very easy to hear.
exam: The man’s voice was so loud that we all could hear him.

desc: When a person is nervous, they think something bad will happen.
exam: The boy became nervous when he heard the news.

desc: A noise is an unpleasant sound.
exam: The crying baby made a loud noise.

desc: A project is a type of work that you do for school ora job.
exam: His afternoon work project was to paint the room green.

desc: To scare someone is to make them feel afraid.
exam: My uncle was scared by what he saw in the room.

desc: A secret is something that you do not tell other people.
exam: The two boys were sharing a secret.

desc: To shout is to say something loudly.
exam: My boss shouted at me because I was late for work.

desc: To smell something means to use your nose to sense it.
exam: The two friends smelled the flower.

desc: If something is terrible, it is very bad.
exam: The way he treated his classmate was terrible.

desc: If something is worse, it is of poorer quality than another thing.
exam: Business was worse this month than last month.

desc: An alien is a creature from a different world.
exam: The alien came in peace.

desc: If you are among certain things, they are all around you.
exam: There was a red apple among the green ones.

desc: A chart is a list of information.
exam: We used a chart to see how we had improved.

desc: A cloud is a group of water drops in the sky.
exam: The sky was filled with white clouds.

desc: To comprehend something is to understand it.
exam: Henry could not comprehend the message.

desc: To describe is to say or write what someone or something is like.
exam: They described their tree as colorful with gold ribbon and a star.

desc: Ever means at any time.
exam: Going skiing last winter was the most fun I’ve ever had.

desc: To fail means you do not succeed in what you try to do.
exam: Since he failed to get the job, he was sad.

desc: Friendly is behaving in a pleasant, kind way toward someone.
exam: The friendly animals came up to the girl.

desc: A grade is a score or mark given to someone’s work.
exam: I managed to get good grades on my report card.

desc: Instead means in place of.
exam: He ate the carrot instead of the ice cream.

desc: A library is a place where you go to read books.
exam: The library at school is full of books.

desc: A planet is a large round thing in space.
exam: Saturn is the planet with the ring around it.

desc: A report is something students write for school.
exam: Karen had trouble writing her report.

desc: Several is more than two but not many.
exam: He had to read several books for class.

desc: To solve something is to find an answer to it.
exam: All the students could easily solve the math problem.

desc: If something happens suddenly, it happens quickly and unexpectedly.
exam: I was suddenly surprised by the cake my friends brought me.

desc: To suppose is to guess.
exam: I suppose I should go home now.

desc: The universe is the known or supposed objects in space.
exam: The universe is so large that it cannot be measured.

desc: To view is to look at something.
exam: Michael likes to view himself in the mirror.

desc: When a thing is appropriate, it is right or normal.
exam: It’s appropriate to wear a suit when you go to the office.

desc: To avoid something is to stay away from it.
exam: Avoid the broken bottle on the floor.

desc: To behave is to act in a particular way, especially to be good.
exam: She always behaves well when her father is around.

desc: When someone is calm, they do not get excited or upset.
exam: A nice warm bath makes me feel so calm.

desc: Concern is a feeling of worry.
exam: I was filled with concern after reading the newspaper.

desc: To be content is to be happy and not want more.
exam: The baby looked very content sitting on the floor.

desc: If you expect something to happen, you believe it will happen.
exam: I expect the bus to be here very soon.

desc: When something happens frequently, it happens often.
exam: We meet frequently, either at the beginning or ending of the week.

desc: A habit is a thing that you do often.
exam: Smoking is a bad habit that can kill you.

desc: To instruct is to teach.
exam: My teacher instructs us in several subjects.

desc: An issue is an important topic.
exam: The men spoke about issues that were important to the people.

desc: None means not any of someone or something.
exam: He spent all his money. There is none left.

desc: If a person is patient, they don’t become angry or upset easily.
exam: I had to be patient and wait until 5 o’clock to leave.

desc: If something is positive, it is good.
exam: She has a positive future ahead of her after finishing college.

desc: To punish means to make someone suffer for breaking the rules or laws.
exam: To punish me, my teacher had me stand in the corner.

desc: To represent is to speak or act for a person or group.
exam: My lawyer will represent me in court.

desc: To shake is to move back and forth or up and down quickly.
exam: When people shake hands, it usually means they agree.

desc: To spread is to move quickly to more places.
exam: I like to spread butter on my toast.

desc: To stroll means to walk slowly and calmly.
exam: My dog and I strolled through the park today.

desc: A village is a very small town.
exam: There are only a few houses in my village.

desc: If you are aware of something, you know about it.
exam: I was not aware of the ringing phone.

desc: Badly means in a severe or harmful way.
exam: He hurt his arm badly playing with friends.

desc: If something belongs to you, you own it.
exam: The blue suit belongs to Paul.

desc: To continue something is to keep doing it.
exam: She stood under her umbrella as the rain continued to fall.

desc: An error is something you do wrong.
exam: I made an error on my report, so my boss was angry.

desc: An experience is something you have seen or done.
exam: Rock climbing was a fun experience.

desc: A field is a big area of land.
exam: The field of flowers looked so pretty.

desc: To hurt is to do something that makes you feel pain.
exam: She hurt her leg falling down the stairs.

desc: Judgment is the ability to form opinions or decisions.
exam: It’s good judgment to recycle your aluminum cans.

desc: If something likely happens, it will probably happen.
exam: I will likely stay at home and watch TV tonight.

desc: If something is normal, it is not strange nor surprising to you.
exam: It is normal for me to bathe every night.

desc: If something is rare, you do not see it very often.
exam: It is rare for him to miss his flight.

desc: To relax is to rest.
exam: The frog relaxed in the warm sun.

desc: To request something is to ask for it.
exam: The little girl requested a special gift from Santa Claus.

desc: To reside means to live somewhere permanently or for a long time.
exam: My brother and his family reside in a lovely house on the beach.

desc: A result is something that happens because of something else.
exam: Asa result of all the rain, the man had to climb on the roof.

desc: To roll is to move by turning over and over.
exam: You must roll the ball into the pins when you bowl.

desc: Since is used to talk about a past event still happening now.
exam: Since 1992, he has been driving that car.

desc: If something is visible, it can be seen.
exam: The moon and stars were visible in the night sky.

desc: If something is wild, it is found in nature.
exam: You should be careful around a fox, because it is a wild animal.

desc: An advantage is something that helps you.
exam: Being tall is an advantage to a basketball player.

desc: To cause is to make something happen.
exam: The cold weather caused her to get sick.

desc: A choice is the act or possibility of picking something.
exam: I had my choice of five doors to open.

desc: A community is a group of people who live together.
exam: The kids from my community usually play together.

desc: To be dead is to not be alive.
exam: A dead person is usually buried in the ground.

desc: The distance between two things is how far it is between them.
exam: The distance between the Earth and the Moon is 384,400 kilometers.

desc: To escape is to run away from something bad.
exam: The butterfly could not escape from the cage.

desc: If you face a problem, you deal with it.
exam: My sister and I have to find a better way to face our differences.

desc: To follow means to go behind someone and go where they go.
exam: The little boy followed his mother home.

desc: Fright is the feeling of being scared.
exam: She was filled with fright.

desc: A ghost is the spirit of a dead person.
exam: Many people are afraid of ghosts.

desc: An individual is one person.
exam: Only one individual could win the bicycle race.

desc: A pet is an animal that lives with people.
exam: Out of all my pets, the dog is my favorite.

desc: To reach means to arrive at a place.
exam: I was happy to finally reach my destination.

desc: To return is to go back to a place.
exam: I was happy to return home to my mom after school.

desc: To survive is to stay alive.
exam: My dog survived her fall into the water.

desc: To be upset is to be unhappy about something.
exam: She was upset because she broke her toy.

desc: A voice is the sound a person makes when they talk or sing.
exam: He used a microphone, so everyone could hear his voice.

desc: The weather is the condition of the air: hot, rainy, windy, etc.
exam: The weather can be sunny, rainy, or cold.

desc: To be wise is to use experience and intelligence to make good choices.
exam: Many people believe that owls are very wise animals.

desc: To allow something to happen means to let it happen.
exam: Having a ticket will allow you to enter the show.

desc: To announce something is to make it known.
exam: He announced to everyone his new idea for the company.

desc: When someone or something is beside you, they are next to you.
exam: The two brothers stood beside each other.

desc: A challenge is something difficult to complete.
exam: It was a challenge to climb to the top of the mountain.

desc: To claim means to say that something is true.
exam: He claimed to know why the country’s laws were weak.

desc: The condition of someone or something is the state that they are in.
exam: The patient’s condition was very good.

desc: To contribute to something means to do something to make it successful.
exam: We decided to contribute money to the new hospital.

desc: A difference is a way that something is not like other things.
exam: The biggest difference between the birds is the color of their feathers.

desc: To divide something is to make it into smaller parts.
exam: We divided the pizza.

desc: An expert is someone who is very good at doing something.
exam: The wizard was an expert at magic.

desc: If someone or something is famous, they are known to many people.
exam: The Eiffel Tower in Paris is very famous.

desc: Force is a person’s strength or power.
exam: He used all his force to try and open the door.

desc: Harm is hurt or problems caused to someone or something.
exam: A hot iron can cause great harm if you are not careful.

desc: To lay means to put or place in a horizontal or flat position.
exam: Don’t lay your socks on the floor.

desc: Peace is a time without war.
exam: A white dove is a symbol for peace.

desc: A prince is the son of a king.
exam: The prince and the princess were married.

desc: To protect someone is to stop them from getting hurt.
exam: Firemen protect us from fires.

desc: To sense something is to know about it without being told.
exam: I could sense that he was watching me.

desc: When something is sudden, it happens very quickly.
exam: He felt a sudden pain in his chest.

desc: Therefore means for this reason.
exam: He is fat. Therefore, he will go on a diet.

desc: To accept something that is offered is to take it.
exam: I accepted the girl’s very nice gift.

desc: To arrange things is to put them in the right place.
exam: Please arrange the bowling pins in order so we can play.

desc: To attend something is to go to it.
exam: My sister and I attend the same school.

desc: To balance something is to keep it from falling.
exam: We saw an elephant balance itself on a ball.

desc: A contrast is the sharp difference between two things.
exam: The contrast between my parents is very noticeable.

desc: To encourage someone is to make them want to do something.
exam: My football coach will encourage us when we are losing.

desc: If someone or something is familiar to you, you know them well.
exam: The two friends were very familiar with each other.

desc: To grab is to take a hold of someone or something suddenly.
exam: I grabbed a pear from the tree.

desc: To hang something is to keep it above the ground.
exam: I drew a picture of my family, and my mother hung it on the wall.

desc: If something is huge, it is very big.
exam: At work, my father drives a huge truck.

desc: If something is necessary, you must do it.
exam: It is necessary to have a passport when you travel to a foreign country.

desc: A pattern is a way in which something is done or organized.
exam: My pattern of brushing my teeth is the same as most people’s.

desc: To propose something is to say that it should be done.
exam: Santa Claus proposed that I try to be a good boy all year.

desc: A purpose is the reason that you do something.
exam: The purpose of exercising is to get into shape.

desc: To release something is to stop holding it.
exam: She released the bird from her hands.

desc: To require something is to say that it is necessary.
exam: We require teachers to have a university degree.

desc: If something is single, then there is only one.
exam: I have a single key in my hand.

desc: Success is doing something well that you choose to do.
exam: My daughter was a big success at school.

desc: To tear something means to pull it apart.
exam: It is easy to tear paper.

desc: A theory is an idea about how something works.
exam: We talked about Einstein’s theory of relativity in class.

desc: To be against something is to be touching it or opposed to it.
exam: They both leaned against the wall.

desc: The beach is a sandy or rocky place by the ocean.
exam: The little girl built a sandcastle on the beach.

desc: To damage something is to break it.
exam: The car was damaged in the accident.

desc: To discover something is to find it for the first time.
exam: I discovered some new information in this book!

desc: An emotion is how you feel.
exam: Anger is a common emotion that we all feel.

desc: To fix something is to make it work.
exam: My dad has many tools to help him fix broken things.

desc: If you are frank, you are being very honest.
exam: The teacher had a frank discussion with her students.

desc: To identify something is to be able to name it.
exam: I used the file to identify his name.

desc: An island is land in the middle of water.
exam: Japan is a group of islands.

desc: The ocean is all of the salt water that surrounds land.
exam: The ocean can make powerful waves.

desc: Perhaps is used when you say that something could happen.
exam: Perhaps I will eat an apple for lunch.

desc: If something is pleasant, you enjoy it.
exam: The character had a pleasant look on its face.

desc: To prevent something is to stop it from happening.
exam: The handcuffs prevented me from moving my hands.

desc: A rock is a hard thing in the dirt.
exam: I stacked rocks on top of one another.

desc: To save something is to keep it from being hurt.
exam: I want to help save the world.

desc: To step is to walk.
exam: Be careful where you step.

desc: Still is used when you say that a situation keeps going on.
exam: They are still waiting in line to get tickets.

desc: A taste is the flavor something makes in your mouth.
exam: The taste of the fruit was sweet.

desc: To throw something is to use your hand to make it go through the air.
exam: The pitcher can throw the baseball very fast.

desc: A wave is a line of water that moves higher than the rest of the water.
exam: The water was filled with large blue waves.

desc: A benefit is a good thing.
exam: Being able to fly is a good benefit to birds.

desc: If you are certain about something, you know it is true.
exam: I am certain that zebras have stripes.

desc: A chance is an opportunity to do something.
exam: I had a chance to see the Roman Coliseum last summer.

desc: An effect is a change made by something else.
exam: The medicine had a good effect on the boy.

desc: If something is essential, it is very important and necessary.
exam: It is essential to have oxygen when you scuba dive.

desc: If something is far, it is not close.
exam: It’s far going from the east coast to the west coast of America.

desc: To focus on something is to think about it and pay attention to it.
exam: My mom always helps me to focus on my school work.

desc: The function of something is what it does.
exam: The function of a flashlight is to help you see in the dark.

desc: Grass is the green leaves that cover the ground.
exam: The grass looked so soft and green.

desc: To guard something is to take care of it.
exam: The police officer will guard us from any harm.

desc: The image of something is a picture of it.
exam: The image of her eye was very clear.

desc: If something is immediate, it happens quickly.
exam: An immediate response came from the pizza place.

desc: If something is primary, it is the most important thing.
exam: His primary thoughts are about money.

desc: If someone feels proud, they are happy about what they have done.
exam: She is proud of the picture she drew of her house.

desc: To remain somewhere is to stay there.
exam: My sister had to remain home since she was sick.

desc: To rest is to stop being active while the body gets back its strength.
exam: I rested on the couch after work.

desc: If two things are separate, they are not together.
exam: New York and Los Angeles are in two separate parts of America.

desc: A site is a place.
exam: We found the perfect site for our picnic.

desc: A tail is a part of an animal’s body, sticking out from its rear or back.
exam: Our dog wags its tail when it’s happy.

desc: Trouble is a problem ora difficulty.
exam: I have trouble working with my boss.

desc: Anymore means any longer.
exam: Her old pants don’t fit her anymore.

desc: When a person is asleep, they are not awake.
exam: The baby has been asleep for hours.

desc: A berry is a small round fruit that grows on certain plants and trees.
exam: The berry looked delicious.

desc: To collect things is to group them together all in one place.
exam: I collected shells when I was younger.

desc: To compete is to try to be better than someone.
exam: He will compete with very good athletes.

desc: A conversation is a talk between people.
exam: There were two conversations going on at once.

desc: A creature is any living thing.
exam: The creature we saw today was either a dolphin or a porpoise.

desc: A decision is a choice.
exam: He made the wrong decision.

desc: Either is used with “or” to say there are two or more possibilities.
exam: You can choose to be either white or black when you play chess.

desc: A forest is a place with lots of trees and animals.
exam: I love to go walking in the forest.

desc: The ground is the top part of the Earth that we walk on.
exam: The ground under our feet was dry and brown.

desc: To introduce someone or something is to say who they are.
exam: I introduced myself to our newest co-worker today.

desc: To marry is to legally become husband and wife.
exam: Rose and Henry were married, and they lived happily.

desc: To prepare is to get ready for something.
exam: I prepared my speech to the class.

desc: To sail is to move a boat on the water.
exam: I love to sail my boat on the lake.

desc: When something is serious, it is bad or unsafe.
exam: The accident was very serious.

desc: To spend is to use time doing something or being somewhere.
exam: I like to spend my free time fishing.

desc: When something is strange, it is not normal.
exam: Joe had a strange look on his face after he saw what happened.

desc: The truth is a fact or something that is right.
exam: He was telling the truth about seeing a large green snake.

desc: To wake is to not be sleeping anymore.
exam: He is always full of energy when he wakes in the morning.

desc: If someone is alone, they are not with another person.
exam: The boy wanted to be alone to think.

desc: An apartment is a set of rooms in a building where people live.
exam: She has a nice apartment in the city.

desc: An article is a story in a newspaper or magazine.
exam: Did you read the article in the newspaper about the soccer game?

desc: An artist is a person who paints, draws, or makes sculptures.
exam: He went to Paris to become an artist.

desc: Someone’s attitude is the way they feel and think.
exam: John has a bad attitude. He’s always angry.

desc: To compare means to say how two things are the same and different.
exam: If you compare cats and dogs, you’ll see that they’re both good pets.

desc: To judge something is to say if it is good or bad.
exam: The boy was going to judge how his mother’s turkey tasted.

desc: A magazine is a regular publication with news, stories, and articles.
exam: She likes to read fashion magazines.

desc: A material is what is used to make something.
exam: Brick is a good material for building houses.

desc: A meal is a time when food is eaten like breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
exam: Breakfast is my favorite meal because I enjoy breakfast foods.

desc: A method is the way to do something.
exam: One method to remember things is to tie a string around your finger.

desc: A neighbor is a person who lives near you.
exam: I like my neighbor because he’s very friendly.

desc: If something is professional, it deals with work that uses special skills.
exam: If you want to be a pilot, you must have professional training.

desc: A profit is the extra money you make when you sell something.
exam: I made a small profit from selling my old clothes.

desc: The quality of something is how good it is.
exam: The quality of his car is very good.

desc: A shape is a simple form like a square or circle.
exam: The triangle is my favorite shape.

desc: A space is an empty area.
exam: I don’t have much space for things in my small house.

desc: Stairs are the things that are used to go up in a building.
exam: You can take the stairs to the second floor.

desc: A symbol is a thing that stands for something else.
exam: This symbol tells us that we cannot smoke in this area.

desc: If someone or something is thin, they are not fat.
exam: The man was thin because he didn’t eat much.

desc: Blood is the red liquid in your body.
exam: I cut my finger and got blood on my shirt.

desc: To burn something is to set it on fire.
exam: I burned some wood in the camp fire.

desc: A cell is a small room where a person is locked in.
exam: The jail cell was very small.

desc: To contain something is to have it inside.
exam: The mailbox contained a letter.

desc: To be correct is to be right.
exam: All of my answers on the test were correct.

desc: A crop is food that a farmer grows.
exam: Wheat is a crop that is made into bread.

desc: To demand something is to say strongly that you want it.
exam: The workers demanded to be paid more money.

desc: To be equal is to be the same.
exam: Both students are equal in age.

desc: To feed is to give food.
exam: Mother feeds my baby brother everyday.

desc: A hole is an opening in something.
exam: The man was going to jump into the hole in the ice.

desc: To increase something is to make it larger or more.
exam: They’ve increased the price of gas by 15 cents!

desc: Long ago, a lord was a man in charge of a town.
exam: The lord of the town was not kind.

desc: To owe is to have to pay or give back something received from another.
exam: I owed him twenty dollars, so I paid him back.

desc: A position is the way something is placed.
exam: How can you sit in that position?

desc: To raise something is to lift it up.
exam: We had to work together to raise the last piece.

desc: If a person is responsible, they do the right things.
exam: I try to be responsible and save money.

desc: A sight is something interesting to see.
exam: I saw the pyramids of Egypt. What a sight!

desc: A spot is a place where something happens.
exam: The kitchen is a good spot to eat meals.

desc: A structure is a building.
exam: They just built a beautiful new structure downtown.

desc: Whole means all of something.
exam: I ate the whole pie. We don’t have any more.

desc: A coach is a person who teaches sports.
exam: My coach gets very excited during games.

desc: To control something is to make it do what you want.
exam: To control the TV, just push the buttons.

desc: A description of someone or something says what they are like.
exam: I gave a description of the man with the gun and hat to the police.

desc: If something is direct, it goes straight between two places.
exam: The green path is a direct route to my house.

desc: An exam is a test.
exam: I did some practice questions for the math exam on the board.

desc: An example of something is a thing that is typical of it.
exam: Cola is an example of a soft drink.

desc: A limit is the largest or smallest amount of something that you allow.
exam: My mother put a limit on how much I could use the phone.

desc: If something is local, it is nearby.
exam: The local market in my neighborhood sells all the food we need.

desc: Magical describes a quality that makes someone or something special.
exam: The fireworks made the night sky look so magical.

desc: Mail is letters and other things sent to people.
exam: I get a lot of mail because I have friends all over the world.

desc: A novel is a book that tells a story.
exam: He wrote a great novel about ancient China.

desc: An outline is the plan for a story or essay.
exam: Before I wrote my essay, I made an outline.

desc: A poet is a person who writes poems.
exam: William Shakespeare was one of the greatest poets.

desc: To print something is to put it onto paper.
exam: Make sure that you print your name clearly.

desc: A scene is one part of a book or movie.
exam: A movie is made up of many short pieces or scenes.

desc: A sheet is a thin flat piece of paper.
exam: I only needed a single sheet of paper to do my homework.

desc: If someone or something is silly, they show a lack of thought.
exam: I made a silly mistake of dropping mom’s vase.

desc: A store is a place where you can buy things.
exam: I picked up a few things at the grocery store.

desc: To suffer is to feel pain.
exam: Her headache made her suffer all day.

desc: Technology is new things made by using science.
exam: He loves technology such as laptop computers.

desc: To go across something is to go to the other side of it.
exam: He walked across the board to the other side.

desc: To breathe means to let air go in and out of your body.
exam: We need strong healthy lungs to help us breathe well.

desc: A characteristic is something that shows what a person or a thing is like.
exam: One characteristic of tigers is their black stripes.

desc: To consume something means to eat or drink it.
exam: Jack consumed a whole plate of spaghetti.

desc: To excite someone means to make them happy and interested.
exam: I heard about the school dance on Friday. This excited me.

desc: If something is extreme, it is in a large amount or degree.
exam: His workout was so extreme that he was sweating heavily.

desc: Fear is the feeling of being afraid.
exam: I have a great fear of skateboarding.

desc: If you are fortunate, you are lucky.
exam: I was fortunate to get a seat.

desc: If someone happens to do something, they do it by chance.
exam: I happened to meet some new friends at school today.

desc: The length of something is how long it is from one end to the other.
exam: The length of the floor is three meters.

desc: A mistake is something you do wrong.
exam: My boss always yells at me when I make a mistake.

desc: To observe something is to watch it.
exam: Brian observed the sun rising over the mountains.

desc: An opportunity is a chance to do something.
exam: I had an opportunity to take pictures in the jungle.

desc: A prize is something of value that is given to the winner.
exam: I won a prize for getting the best grade on my science test.

desc: A race is a contest to see who is the fastest.
exam: Paul is a fast runner, so he easily won the race.

desc: To realize is to suddenly understand.
exam: After I left my house, I realized that I left the light on.

desc: To respond is to give an answer to what someone else said.
exam: When the teacher asked the question, we all responded.

desc: A risk is a chance of something bad happening.
exam: I took a risk and climbed the snowy mountain.

desc: To wonder is to ask yourself questions or have a need to know.
exam: The young mother wondered if she’d have a boy or a girl.

desc: Yet is used to say something has not happened up to now.
exam: We can’t go out yet; we’re still eating.

desc: An academy is a special type of school.
exam: There are many courses taught at the academy that I go to.

desc: If something is ancient, it is very old.
exam: I want to see the ancient buildings in Rome.

desc: A board is a flat piece of wood.
exam: The sign was made of a few wooden boards.

desc: A century is one hundred years.
exam: Our company is celebrating a century of business in London.

desc: A clue is a fact or object that helps solve a mystery or crime.
exam: The detective found some clues on the sidewalk.

desc: A concert is an event where you listen to people play music.
exam: I enjoyed the concert last night. The band was very good.

desc: A county is the largest political division of a state in the US.
exam: He wanted to represent the citizens of his county.

desc: A dictionary is a book that tells you what words mean.
exam: I use the dictionary to learn new words.

desc: To exist is to be real.
exam: Do you really think that unicorns ever existed?

desc: Flat describes something that is level and smooth with no curved parts.
exam: My parents bought a new flat screen TV over the weekend.

desc: A gentleman is a nice man.
exam: My grandfather is a kind and helpful gentleman.

desc: Hidden means to be not easily noticed or too hard to find.
exam: The hidden camera recorded everything in the parking lot.

desc: Maybe is used to show that something is possible or may be true.
exam: If I focus hard enough, maybe I can come up with the right answer.

desc: An officer is a leader in the army.
exam: The soldiers followed the orders of the officer.

desc: If something is original, it is the first one of that thing.
exam: This is the original painting of the Mona Lisa.

desc: To pound something is to hit it many times with a lot of force.
exam: He pounded the nail with the hammer.

desc: A process is the steps to take to do something.
exam: Making a cake is a long process.

desc: To publish a book is to get it printed and ready to sell.
exam: That company publishes daily newspapers.

desc: A theater is a building where you watch plays, shows, and movies.
exam: We went to the theater to see a play.

desc: Wealth is a large amount of money.
exam: One of the most important things to some people is wealth.

desc: To appreciate something is to understand its good qualities.
exam: I can appreciate the lovely scenery.

desc: If something is available, it means you can get it.
exam: There were many seats available in the room.

desc: To beat someone means to do better than they do.
exam: I managed to beat everyone in the race.

desc: If something is bright, it shows a lot of light.
exam: The bright light from the explosion hurt my eyes.

desc: To celebrate is to do something to show that an event is special.
exam: We all celebrated when we heard the great news.

desc: To determine means to choose or make a decision.
exam: He tried to determine which one to eat first.

desc: To disappear means to go away or not be seen.
exam: The top of the building is disappearing in the clouds.

desc: If you talk about something else, you talk about something different.
exam: I wanted a bike for my birthday, but I got something else.

desc: Fair describes treating someone in a way that is reasonable or right.
exam: He sold me his car for a fair price.

desc: To flow is to move easily and continuously in one direction.
exam: The water flowed over the rocks and into the lake.

desc: If you move forward, you move in the direction in front of you.
exam: When he saw his mother, the baby crawled forward to her.

desc: A hill is a round area of land. It is higher than the land around it.
exam: The sun was rising above the green hills.

desc: A level is a point on a scale that measures something.
exam: Please check the level of the temperature.

desc: If someone or something is lone, they are the only one of that kind.
exam: A lone man walked along the street.

desc: A puddle is a pool of liquid on the ground.
exam: When the ice melted, it formed a puddle.

desc: A response is the answer to a question.
exam: He asked if I was sad. My response was “No.”

desc: A season is a time of the year: spring, summer, fall or winter.
exam: Fall is a warm season, while winter is very cold.

desc: A solution is a way to solve a problem.
exam: There are many problems. We need solutions!

desc: To waste means to carelessly use something all up.
exam: Turn off the water so you don’t waste it.

desc: You use whether when you must choose between two things.
exam: I could not decide whether to go left or right.

desc: To argue is to angrily speak to someone because you do not agree.
exam: We argued about where to go for dinner.

desc: To communicate is to give information by talking, writing, etc.
exam: I communicated with Paul about his new ideas.

desc: A crowd is a large group of people.
exam: A large crowd had gathered on the street to see the accident.

desc: To depend on someone or something is to need them.
exam: Children depend on their parents for many things.

desc: A dish is a plate.
exam: She put a clean white dish on the table.

desc: If something is empty, it does not have anything in it.
exam: My gas tank was almost empty, so I couldn’t drive my car very long.

desc: If something is exact, it is just the right amount.
exam: Please use the exact amount of sugar for the cake.

desc: If something is fresh, it is new.
exam: I just bought these oranges. They are very fresh.

desc: To gather is to collect several things usually from different places.
exam: Sam gathered some flowers for his mother.

desc: To indicate means to show, point or make something clear.
exam: He pointed to his eyes to indicate where he had hurt himself.

desc: An item is a thing that you buy or sell.
exam: I have many items for school in my bag.

desc: To offer is to present someone with something.
exam: He offered me the keys to his car.

desc: The price of something is how much it costs.
exam: What is the price of this item?

desc: A product is something that is made.
exam: My sister has many beauty products in her room.

desc: Property is something that someone owns.
exam: The house is now my property.

desc: To purchase something is to buy it.
exam: I recently purchased a new car.

desc: To recommend something is to say that someone should do it.
exam: My doctor recommended that I get some exercise.

desc: To select something is to choose it.
exam: I hope that I selected the right answers on the test.

desc: A tool is something that helps you do a task.
exam: We used a tool to fix the window.

desc: To treat is to act in a certain way toward someone.
exam: The cats treated the mouse very nicely.

desc: If someone or something is alive, they are not dead.
exam: My grandparents are still alive even though they are over 90.

desc: A bone is a hard part of the body.
exam: I brought home a nice bone for my dog.

desc: To bother is to make the effort to do something.
exam: No one bothered to wash the dishes today.

desc: A captain is the person who leads a ship or airplane.
exam: The captain sailed his ship to Australia.

desc: The conclusion of something is the final part of it.
exam: At the conclusion of the race, the spectators cheered for the winner.

desc: Doubt is a feeling of not being sure.
exam: I have doubt that the story is true.

desc: To explore is to look for new places.
exam: He wants to explore the world and see new things.

desc: If something is foreign, it is from a different country.
exam: Mexican food is a popular foreign food.

desc: If you are glad, you are happy.
exam: I am glad you came to my party.

desc: However means despite or not being influenced by something.
exam: She is a great cook. However, she never had professional lessons.

desc: Injustice is a lack of fairness or justice.
exam: Putting an innocent person in jail is an act of injustice.

desc: If something is international, it involves more than one country.
exam: The United Nations is a powerful international organization.

desc: A lawyer works with the law and represents people in court.
exam: The lawyer left the courthouse after the judge made her decision.

desc: To mention something is to talk about it.
exam: The doctors mentioned the problems that the patient was having.

desc: A policy is a rule.
exam: He told us that his policy was to put customers first.

desc: If something is social, it is about many people in a community.
exam: People should come together and fix the world’s social problems.

desc: A speech is something said to a group of people.
exam: She gave a speech to the class.

desc: A staff is a group of people working together in a company.
exam: My dad has a staff of four people to help him at the office.

desc: If you go toward something, you go closer to it.
exam: Santa walked toward my house with a special tree.

desc: Wood is the thing that trees are made of.
exam: I put the pieces of wood in a pile.

desc: To achieve something is to successfully do it after trying hard.
exam: I was happy that I could achieve my goal.

desc: To advise someone is to tell them what to do.
exam: My mother often advises people about their money.

desc: If something happens already, it happens before a certain time.
exam: It is already time for the movie to start. Let’s go in.

desc: If something is basic, it is very simple or easy.
exam: I learned some basic English skills in school today.

desc: A bit is a small amount of something.
exam: I ate a bit of chocolate before I went to bed.

desc: To consider something means to think about it.
exam: Pete didn’t like his job. He considered getting a new one.

desc: To destroy means to damage something so badly that it cannot be used.
exam: The glass was destroyed.

desc: To entertain someone is to do something that they enjoy.
exam: The clown entertained the kids at the party.

desc: If something is extra, it is more than what is needed.
exam: The squirrel had extra nuts for the winter.

desc: A goal is something you work toward.
exam: Her goal was to become a doctor.

desc: To lie is to say or write something untrue to deceive someone.
exam: Whenever Pinocchio lied to his father, his nose grew.

desc: Meat is food made of animals.
exam: This piece of meat I’m eating tastes very good.

desc: An opinion is a thought about a person or a thing.
exam: Meg told me her opinion of my story. She said it was not funny.

desc: If something is real, it actually exists.
exam: The handbag has a stamp on it, so it’s real.

desc: To reflect is when a surface sends back light, heat, sound or an image.
exam: Her face was reflected on the smooth glass.

desc: To regard someone or something is to think of them in a certain way.
exam: The boy regarded the girl as a good friend.

desc: To serve someone is to give them food or drinks.
exam: He served us our drinks quickly.

desc: A vegetable is a plant used as food.
exam: Carrots are my favorite vegetable.

desc: A war is a big fight between two groups of people.
exam: Many young men died in the war.

desc: If something is worth an amount of money, it costs that amount.
exam: Our house is worth a lot of money.

desc: To appear is to seem.
exam: She appeared to be sad. She was crying.

desc: The base is the bottom of something.
exam: The base of the table has three legs.

desc: The brain is the organ in your head that lets you think.
exam: You must use your brain to solve the problem.

desc: A career is a job that you do for a large part of your life.
exam: He was in the hospitality business for most of his career.

desc: A clerk is a type of worker. Clerks in a store help customers.
exam: The clerk added up her bill for the groceries.

desc: Effort is hard work or an attempt to do something.
exam: He always puts a lot of effort into his studies.

desc: To enter a place is to go into it.
exam: Two guards greeted me as I entered the front door.

desc: When something is excellent, it is very good.
exam: I got an excellent score on my school test.

desc: A hero is a brave person who does things to help others.
exam: To children, the man in the blue and red costume was a real hero.

desc: To hurry is to do something quickly.
exam: I hurried home on my bike.

desc: To inform someone is to tell them about something.
exam: I called and informed her about my idea.

desc: Later means after the present, expected, or usual time.
exam: She missed the train, so she’ll arrive a little later than expected.

desc: To leave means to go away from someone or something.
exam: He packed his bag and was ready to leave for home.

desc: To locate something is to find it.
exam: I could not locate my keys in the house.

desc: A nurse is a person who helps sick people in the hospital.
exam: A nurse helped me get better.

desc: An operation is when a doctor replaces or removes something in the body.
exam: The operation on my arm was a success.

desc: Pain is the feeling that you have when you are hurt.
exam: His head was full of pain.

desc: To refuse something is to say “no” to it.
exam: The dog refused to play with the cat.

desc: Though is used when the second idea makes the first seem surprising.
exam: Though he was overweight, he liked to be active.

desc: If something is various, there are many types of it.
exam: She owned shoes of various styles.

desc: Actual means that something is real or true.
exam: This is the actual sword that the King owned, not a fake one.

desc: To amaze someone is to surprise them very much.
exam: The news in the paper amazed Jack.

desc: A charge is the price to pay for something.
exam: The charge for the shirts was $15.00.

desc: To comfort someone means to make them feel better.
exam: I wanted to comfort my friend after I heard the bad news.

desc: To contact someone is to speak or write to them.
exam: I contacted Sue about my party.

desc: A customer is a person who buys something at a store.
exam: The customer put a few items in a bag.

desc: To deliver something is to take it from one place to another.
exam: The man delivered Chinese food to my house.

desc: To earn means to get money for the work you do.
exam: He earns his living as a chef in a great restaurant.

desc: A gate is a type of door. Gates are usually made of metal or wood.
exam: We want to put up a wooden gate around our house.

desc: To include something means to have it as part of a group.
exam: Does this meal include a soft drink?

desc: To manage something means to control or be in charge of it.
exam: I had to manage the meeting myself.

desc: A mystery is something that is difficult to understand or explain.
exam: The path on the map was a complete mystery to me.

desc: To occur means to happen.
exam: When did the thunderstorm occur?

desc: If A is the opposite of B, A is completely different from B.
exam: The opposite of black is white.

desc: A plate is a flat round thing that you put food on.
exam: I put my plate down so I could put some food on it.

desc: To receive something is to get it.
exam: I received a present on my birthday.

desc: A reward is something given in exchange for good behavior or work.
exam: He was given a reward for his excellent performance.

desc: To set something is to put it somewhere.
exam: Please set the dice down on the table.

desc: To steal is to take something that is not yours.
exam: The men tried to steal money from the bank.

desc: A thief is someone who quietly takes things that do not belong to them.
exam: A thief broke into our home and took my mother's jewelry.

desc: To advance is to go forward.
exam: He advanced up the ladder slowly.

desc: An athlete is a person who plays sports.
exam: Some athletes can play many sports very well.

desc: If something is average, it is at a normal level.
exam: I’m not rich or poor; I’m average.

desc: Your behavior is the way you act.
exam: Their behavior was good this semester. They didn’t cause trouble.

desc: Behind means to be at the back of something.
exam: The little girl was hiding behind a tree.

desc: A course is a class in school.
exam: I took a P.E. course in school this year.

desc: To lower something is to make it go down.
exam: The chart shows how his production has lowered over the year.

desc: To match is to be the same or similar.
exam: The two shoes matched. They looked the same.

desc: A member is a person who is part of a group.
exam: Julie is the newest member of our team.

desc: If something is mental, it has to do with your mind.
exam: I made a mental picture of the room.

desc: A passenger is a person who rides in a car, train, or airplane.
exam: One passenger was standing in the subway train.

desc: Your personality is what you are like and how you behave.
exam: John has a bad personality.

desc: A poem is a short kind of writing.
exam: William Shakespeare wrote many poems.

desc: A pole is a long thin stick made of wood or metal that supports things.
exam: The flag was hanging from the flag pole.

desc: To remove something is to take it away.
exam: I removed the nail from the board.

desc: Safety means to be the condition of being safe and free from danger.
exam: For his own safety, he was placed in a car seat.

desc: To shoot is to fire something like a bullet at someone or something.
exam: The hunter raised his gun to shoot at the target.

desc: To sound means to make a noise.
exam: The alarm clock sounded and woke us all up.

desc: To swim is to move through water.
exam: I love to swim in the ocean.
Mom cleaned the spider webs out of the garage.

desc: A block is a solid piece of wood, stone or ice.
exam: I saw a block of ice on the floor.

desc: To cheer is to give a loud shout of approval or encouragement.
exam: The crowd all cheered when the home team won.

desc: If something is complex, it has many small parts. It is hard to understand.
exam: A jig-saw puzzle can be complex because it has so many pieces.

desc: A critic is someone who give their opinions about movies, books, plays.
exam: The wine critic tasted the wine so he could give his opinion.

desc: An event is something that happens, especially something important.
exam: Finishing high school was a major event in his life.

desc: To exercise is to run or play sports so that you can be healthy.
exam: You should exercise every day.

desc: If something fits, it is small enough or the right size to go there.
exam: The colorful eggs fit into the box.

desc: Friendship is the relationship between people who are friends.
exam: Michael and Lisa have a very strong friendship with each other.

desc: A guide is someone who shows you where to go.
exam: We followed a guide at the park.

desc: If there is a lack of something, there is not enough of it.
exam: His only problem is a lack of money.

desc: A passage is a long area with walls that goes from one place to another.
exam: The long passage led us to the other side of the field.

desc: To perform is to do something in front of people who watch.
exam: He will perform a song for the class.

desc: Pressure is what you apply to make someone do something.
exam: They put pressure on him to change his mind.

desc: If something is probable, it is likely to happen.
exam: It is probable that you will get a good grade if you study for the test.

desc: If something is public, it is meant for everyone to use.
exam: I went to the public park to play with my friends.

desc: To strike someone or something is to hit them.
exam: She struck the other girl in the face.

desc: To support something is to like it and help it be successful.
exam: Everyone at work supports the new plan.

desc: A task is work that someone has to do.
exam: Who has the task of building the brick wall?

desc: A term is a word for something.
exam: I often use the term “oops” when I make a mistake.

desc: To unite is to get together to do something.
exam: If we unite, we can finish our project faster.

desc: To associate means to connect something with a person or thing.
exam: Most people associate birthday parties with having fun.

desc: The environment is the place where people work or live.
exam: Keeping our environment clean is important to our health.

desc: A factory is a building where things are made or put together.
exam: We have only one factory in our town.

desc: A feature is an important part of something.
exam: The cell phone has many features.

desc: An instance is an example of something.
exam: I have never experienced an instance of hate. Have you?

desc: To involve means to be actively taking part in something.
exam: The whole family was involved in playing the game.

desc: Medicine is something you take to feel better or treat an illness.
exam: The doctor gave me medicine for my cold.

desc: A mix is different things put together.
exam: The green mix we made in science class spilled onto the table.

desc: To organize is to plan or get ready for an event.
exam: Make a list to help you organize the things you need.

desc: A period is an amount of time when something happens.
exam: In one period in Europe, there were many knights.

desc: If people populate an area, they live there.
exam: Billions of people populate the Earth.

desc: To produce something is to make or grow it.
exam: This tree produces apples every year.

desc: A range is a number or a set of similar things.
exam: I saw a range of cars to choose from.

desc: To recognize something is to know it because you have seen it before.
exam: I recognized an old friend from many years ago.

desc: If something is regular, it happens often and in equal amounts of time.
exam: Our regular lunch time is around noon.

desc: A sign is a notice giving information, directions, a warning, etc.
exam: The sign indicated that today would be a bad day.

desc: A tip is a pointed end of something.
exam: The tip of his pen was very sharp.

desc: A tradition is something people have been doing for a long time.
exam: Marriage is a tradition all over the world.

desc: Trash is waste material or unwanted or worthless things.
exam: Please take out the trash; it smells bad.

desc: If something is wide, it is large from side to side.
exam: The door was as wide as my arms.

desc: Advice is an opinion about what to do.
exam: I don’t know how to study for my exams. Can you give me some advice?

desc: Along means to move from one part of a road, river, etc. to another.
exam: Walk along this tunnel for ten minutes, and you’ll see a door on the left.

desc: Attention is the notice, thought, or consideration of someone.
exam: His work got the attention of two of his co-workers.

desc: To attract means to make a person or thing come closer or be interested.
exam: The magnet attracted the metal.

desc: To climb means to use your hands and feet to go up on something.
exam: The girls climbed to the top of the mountain.

desc: To drop is to fall or allow something to fall.
exam: A small amount of water dropped from the bottle.

desc: If something is final, it is the last part.
exam: In the final part of the film, the man and the woman got married.

desc: Further is used to say something is from a distance or time.
exam: The escalator is further along than I thought.

desc: To imply something is to suggest it without saying it.
exam: The man implied that he wanted the job, but he didn’t say so.

desc: To maintain means to make something stay the same.
exam: The balls maintain constant movement.

desc: You use neither to connect two negative statements.
exam: Neither the pass on the left nor the pass on the right will lead us home.

desc: Otherwise means different or in another way.
exam: It’s good to stay active; otherwise, you’ll gain weight.

desc: If something is physical, it is related to your body and not your mind.
exam: Biking is good for your physical health.

desc: To prove something is to show that it is true.
exam: My teacher proved the answer on the board.

desc: To react is to act in a certain way because of something that happened.
exam: James reacted badly to the news.

desc: To ride something is to travel on it. You can ride an animal, a bike, etc.
exam: I will ride a roller-coaster for the first time today.

desc: If something is situated somewhere, it is in that place.
exam: The white board is situated between the two men.

desc: Society is people and the way that they live.
exam: Society expects people to be good and honest.

desc: A standard is what people consider normal or good.
exam: This older model TV is below our store’s standards.

desc: To suggest something means to give an idea or plan about it.
exam: He suggested that we go to see his boss.

desc: Actually means in fact or really.
exam: My dad looks a little mean, but actually he’s very kind.

desc: Bite is the act of using your teeth to cut and tear into something.
exam: The boy took a big bite out of his hamburger.

desc: The coast is the land by an ocean.
exam: I stayed on the southern coast of Australia.

desc: A deal is an agreement that you have with another person.
exam: I made a deal with the other company to give us some money.

desc: The desert is an area of land without many plants or water.
exam: Not many plants grow in the desert.

desc: An earthquake is a shaking movement of the ground.
exam: The building shook during the earthquake.

desc: If something is effective, it works well.
exam: Swimming is an effective way to stay healthy.

desc: To examine something is to look at it carefully.
exam: The doctor examined my eyes today.

desc: If something is false, it is not correct.
exam: If you think the answer is false, press the red button.

desc: A gift is something you give someone.
exam: Dave received many gifts for Christmas.

desc: Hunger is the feeling that you get when you need to eat.
exam: After playing all day long, he was filled with hunger.

desc: To imagine something is to think of it in your mind.
exam: Sally imagined herself winning lots of money.

desc: A journey is a long trip.
exam: I went on a journey across the country with my parents.

desc: A puzzle is something that is hard to understand.
exam: The question was a puzzle to him.

desc: Quite is used to say that something is complete or very much.
exam: I think typing on a keyboard is quite easy.

desc: Rather is used when you want to do one thing but not the other.
exam: I would rather have the red one than the blue one.

desc: If something is specific, it is precise or exact.
exam: Please choose a specific place on the map.

desc: A tour is a short trip in which you see many sights.
exam: I took a tour of Asia and Europe.

desc: A trip is a journey to a certain place.
exam: Ken took a trip to the city yesterday.

desc: If something has value, it is worth a lot of money.
exam: Matthew found a treasure of very high value.

desc: A band is a group of people who play music.
exam: My brother is in a rock band.

desc: Barely means by the smallest amount, almost not.
exam: I barely had enough money to pay for my bus ticket.

desc: If something is boring, it is not fun.
exam: I think the Internet is boring.

desc: To cancel means to decide that an event or a request will not happen.
exam: She cancelled the rest of her plans because of the rain.

desc: A driveway is a short private road that leads to a person’s home.
exam: The long driveway led us to their new house.

desc: Garbage is waste material like unwanted or spoiled food, bottles, paper, etc.
exam: The boy cleaned up the garbage around his house.

desc: An instrument is something designed to do a certain task like music.
exam: My favorite musical instrument is the piano.

desc: A list is a record of information printed with an item on each line.
exam: My mom makes a list of groceries to buy.

desc: Magic is the power to do impossible things.
exam: The magician used magic to pull a rabbit out of his hat.

desc: A message is a set of words that you send to someone.
exam: I left a message for you in the envelope.

desc: To notice something is to see it for the first time.
exam: Did you notice the view?

desc: To own something means to have it. That thing belongs to you.
exam: My grandfather owns that house.

desc: To predict something is to say that it will happen.
exam: She predicted that I would get married next year.

desc: A professor is a person who teaches in college.
exam: Mike’s science professor knows a lot about physics.

desc: To rush is to go somewhere or do something very quickly.
exam: Nancy rushed to finish her homework.

desc: A schedule is a plan that tells you when to do things.
exam: What is your class schedule for today?

desc: To share something is to give some of it to another person.
exam: Jimmy shared his apple with me.

desc: A stage is a place where actors or musicians act or sing.
exam: A large screen was on the stage.

desc: A storm is very bad weather. There is a lot of rain or snow.
exam: Did that storm wake you up last night?

desc: You use within to say that something is inside another thing.
exam: Within the box, there was a pizza.

desc: To advertise is to tell people about something on TV, radio, etc.
exam: They used a rabbit to help them advertise their product.

desc: To assign something to someone is to tell them to do it.
exam: I assigned the worker an important task.

desc: An audience is a group of people who watch something together.
exam: There was a large audience at the game.

desc: Breakfast is the first meal of the day.
exam: I eat breakfast at 8:00 every morning.

desc: A competition is a contest to see who is the best at something.
exam: He won the running competition over the weekend.

desc: If the weather is cool, it is a little bit cold.
exam: The weather is cool in the fall.

desc: If you gain something, you get more of it.
exam: I gained some weight over the summer.

desc: Importance means the quality or condition of being needed or valued.
exam: VIPs are people of great importance.

desc: Knowledge is information that you have about something.
exam: A music teacher should have good knowledge of music.

desc: If something is major, it is big or important.
exam: I have a major problem. My boss wants me to redo my project!

desc: Mean describes someone who is unkind or cruel.
exam: My co-worker is a very mean person. He gets angry very quickly.

desc: If you prefer something, you want it more than something else.
exam: I prefer to take the path that will lead me to a bright future.

desc: A president is the leader of a country.
exam: The president of our country made an important announcement.

desc: Progress is the act of getting closer to doing or finishing something.
exam: Our company made financial progress this year.

desc: Respect is a good opinion of someone because they are good.
exam: I have great respect for firemen.

desc: Ifyou are rich, you have a lot of money.
exam: He’s rich. He can buy anything he wants.

desc: A skill is the knowledge and ability that allows you to do something well.
exam: A snowboarder must have the right skills to do well.

desc: Somehow means in a way or by some means which is not known.
exam: He somehow had to find a way to reach the life preserver.

desc: Strength is the physical power that you have.
exam: Exercising will increase your strength and give you more power.

desc: To vote is to officially choose between two or more things.
exam: I voted for Billy to be our class president.

desc: If something is above, it is at a higher level than something else.
exam: He straightened the sign that was above the crowd.

desc: If something is ahead of something else, it is in front of it.
exam: The blue car drove on ahead of us.

desc: An amount is how much there is of something.
exam: Can I use my card to pay for the entire amount?

desc: A belief is a strong feeling that something is correct or true.
exam: A preacher or priest should have a strong belief in God.

desc: The center of something is the middle of it.
exam: The center of a dart board is the most important spot.

desc: If something is common, it happens often or there is much of it.
exam: It is common for snow to fall in the winter.

desc: To cost is to require expenditure or payment.
exam: These designer shoes cost more than the regular ones.

desc: To demonstrate something is to show how it is done.
exam: She demonstrated her plan to her co-workers.

desc: Different describes someone or something that is not the same as others.
exam: Each of my sisters has a different hair style from one another.

desc: Evidence is a fact or thing that you use to prove something.
exam: He used the pictures as evidence that UFOs are real.

desc: Honesty means the quality of being truthful or honest.
exam: A courtroom should be a place of honesty.

desc: An idiom is a phrase with a meaning different from its words.
exam: The idiom “when pigs fly” means that something will never happen.

desc: If something is independent, it is not controlled by something else.
exam: She chose to live an independent life in the country.

desc: Inside means the inner part, space or side of something.
exam: The inside of the box was empty.

desc: A master is a person who is very good at something.
exam: My brother is a master of taekwondo.

desc: A memory is something you remember.
exam: The memory of my first time in the city will always be the best.

desc: If something is proper, it is right.
exam: It is not proper to throw your garbage on the road.

desc: To scan something is to look at it very carefully.
exam: You must scan each person closely.

desc: A section is a part of something larger.
exam: The green section of the graph is the most important part.

desc: The surface of something is the top part or outside of it.
exam: The surface of the moon is very rough.
